snippet: The vaccines would first be given to health care workers most at risk of exposure to the disease in West Africa, the World Health Organization said.
abstract: World Health Organization says two potential vaccines against Ebola virus ravaging West Africa could be available as soon as November and will first be given to health care workers most at risk of exposure to the disease.

byline.original: By SHERI FINK and RICK GLADSTONE

lead_paragraph: The vaccines would first be given to health care workers most at risk of exposure to the disease in West Africa, the World Health Organization said.

headline.main: Two Vaccines to Protect Against Ebola Could Be Available Within Weeks
headline.print_headline: Two Vaccines to Protect Against Ebola Could Be Available Within Weeks
